alert.note: Alert for Gosper (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 22 at 1:38AM CDT until September 22 at 4:45AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following county, Gosper. * WHEN...Until 830 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 137 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Elk Creek, East Branch Turkey Creek, Turkey Creek, East Branch Muddy Creek, Plum Creek, West Branch Turkey Creek, Elwood Reservoir Area, Spring Creek, Swartz Creek, Dry Creek and Johnson Lake Area. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bertrand, Elwood, Smithfield and Johnson Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
